entry.dcterms:title: Socio-political attitudes in Hungary after the joining of the European Union (EU), 2005 - Szonda Ipsos subsample
entry.dcterms:creator: Hegedűs, Péter
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-H45: Socio-political attitudes in Hungary after the joining of the European Union (EU), 2005 - Szonda Ipsos subsample. data sheet. Version: 2011-03-24
entry.dcterms:creator: Tardos, Róbert
Tóka, Gábor
entry.dcterms:description: The Hungarian Election Study (HES) project was initiated by the Hungarian Center for Democracy Foundation and has been conducting collaborative studies of Hungarian voting behavior and public opinion since 2003. The primary aim of HES is to study electoral behavior from a broader social science perspective in collaboration with major Hungarian research institutes. It focuses on the interrelationship between cleavage structures, social and cultural stratification, and digital divides. HES studies are also putting emphasis on the methodological questions of empirical survey based research. This dataset is collected by the Median Institute with a 1000-person sample. The another part of the research is collected by the Szonda Institute (with a same large sample).

survey data
cross-section
Multi-stage proportionately stratified national probability sample representative of the adult Hungarian population. Respondents were selected using the random walking method out of each strata.
face-to-face interview
